item.title: Theory of Magnetoroton Bands in Moiré Materials
item.description:
Author(s): Bishoy M. Kousa, Nicolás Morales-Durán, Tobias M. R. Wolf, Eslam Khalaf, and Allan H. MacDonald

The recent realization of Hofstadter spectra and fractional Chern insulators in moiré materials has introduced a new ingredient, a periodic lattice potential, to the study of quantum Hall phases. While the fractionalized states in moiré systems are expected to be in the same universality class as th…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 246604] Published Thu Dec 11, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): Bishoy M. Kousa, Nicolás Morales-Durán, Tobias M. R. Wolf, Eslam Khalaf, and Allan H. MacDonald

The recent realization of Hofstadter spectra and fractional Chern insulators in moiré materials has introduced a new ingredient, a periodic lattice potential, to the study of quantum Hall phases. While the fractionalized states in moiré systems are expected to be in the same universality class as th…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 246604] Published Thu Dec 11, 2025

item.title: Magneto-Optical Trapping of Aluminum Monofluoride
item.description:
Author(s): J. E. Padilla-Castillo, J. Cai, P. Agarwal, P. Kukreja, R. Thomas, B. G. Sartakov, S. Truppe, G. Meijer, and S. C. Wright

A class of molecules with two valence electrons has been laser cooled and trapped for the first time.


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 243401] Published Wed Dec 10, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): J. E. Padilla-Castillo, J. Cai, P. Agarwal, P. Kukreja, R. Thomas, B. G. Sartakov, S. Truppe, G. Meijer, and S. C. Wright

A class of molecules with two valence electrons has been laser cooled and trapped for the first time.


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 243401] Published Wed Dec 10, 2025

item.title: Topological Chiral Superconductivity Mediated by Intervalley Antiferromagnetic Fluctuations in Twisted Bilayer ${\mathrm{WSe}}_{2}$
item.description:
Author(s): Wei Qin, Wen-Xuan Qiu, and Fengcheng Wu

Motivated by the recent observations of superconductivity in twisted bilayer ${\mathrm{WSe}}_{2}$ (${\mathrm{tWSe}}_{2}$), we theoretically investigate the superconductivity driven by an electronic mechanism. We first demonstrate that the multiband screened Coulomb interaction within the random phas…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 246002] Published Tue Dec 09, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): Wei Qin, Wen-Xuan Qiu, and Fengcheng Wu

Motivated by the recent observations of superconductivity in twisted bilayer WSe2 (tWSe2), we theoretically investigate the superconductivity driven by an electronic mechanism. We first demonstrate that the multiband screened Coulomb interaction within the random phase approximation is insufficient …


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 246002] Published Tue Dec 09, 2025

item.title: Luttinger Count is the Homotopy Not the Physical Charge: Generalized Anomalies Characterize Non-Fermi Liquids
item.description:
Author(s): Gabriele La Nave, Jinchao Zhao, and Philip W. Phillips

We show that the Luttinger-Ward functional can be formulated as an operator insertion in the path integral and hence can be thought of as a generalized symmetry. The key result is that the associated charge, always quantized, defines the homotopy, not the physical charge. The disconnect between the …


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 246501] Published Mon Dec 08, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): Gabriele La Nave, Jinchao Zhao, and Philip W. Phillips

We show that the Luttinger-Ward functional can be formulated as an operator insertion in the path integral and hence can be thought of as a generalized symmetry. The key result is that the associated charge, always quantized, defines the homotopy, not the physical charge. The disconnect between the …

item.title: Family of Aperiodic Tilings with Tunable Quantum Geometric Tensor
item.description:
Author(s): Hector Roche Carrasco, Justin Schirmann, Aurelien Mordret, and Adolfo G. Grushin

The strict geometric rules that define aperiodic tilings lead to the unique spectral and transport properties of quasicrystals, but also limit our ability to design them. In this Letter, we explore a novel example of a continuously tunable family of two-dimensional aperiodic tilings in which the und…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 236603] Published Thu Dec 04, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): Hector Roche Carrasco, Justin Schirmann, Aurelien Mordret, and Adolfo G. Grushin

The strict geometric rules that define aperiodic tilings lead to the unique spectral and transport properties of quasicrystals, but also limit our ability to design them. In this Letter, we explore a novel example of a continuously tunable family of two-dimensional aperiodic tilings in which the und…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 236603] Published Thu Dec 04, 2025
